analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: mon sran gre'u dang til la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mon sran gre'u dang til la sogs pas so //
translated: By beans, sesame seeds, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni 'o ma dang / zho dang / til gyi 'ba' cha la sogs pa'i kha zas kyi bye brag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni 'o ma dang / zho dang / til gyi 'ba' cha la sogs pa'i kha zas kyi bye brag rnams kyis so //
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the various kinds of food such as milk, curd, sesame oil, etc.

original: mtshan mo gnyid log pa ni mtshan mo bde bar gnyid log pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gnyid log pa ni mtshan mo bde bar gnyid log pas gnas pa'o //
translated: “Sleeping at night” means sleeping happily at night.

original: rang gi zas legs par zhu ba ni kha zas bde mor zhu bar gyur pa'o /
analyzed: rang gi zas legs par zhu ba ni kha zas bde mor zhu bar gyur pa'o /
translated: “One’s food is well digested” means that one’s food is digested well.

original: sngo dro ni nyi ma'i cha dang po'o //
analyzed: sngo dro ni nyi ma'i cha dang po'o //
translated: “Morning” means the first part of the day.

original: bkra shis bya ba ni byin rlob cing dge ba ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis bya ba ni byin rlob cing dge ba ston par byed pa'o //
translated: “Auspicious” means that one is blessed and that good things are predicted.

original: de bzhin du zas ma zos pa ni kha zas longs spyad pa ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zas ma zos pa ni kha zas longs spyad pa ma byas pa'o //
translated: “One has not eaten” means that one has not yet eaten.

original: yang cung zad snum pa ni snum gyi bya ba cung zad byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang cung zad snum pa ni snum gyi bya ba cung zad byas pa'o //
translated: “A little oil” means that one has done a little oil therapy.

original: thug pa ni nas thug go //
analyzed: thug pa ni nas thug go //
translated: “Porridge” means barley porridge.

original: de zhun mar cung zad btab la btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zhun mar cung zad btab la btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should drink it after adding a little ghee.

original: de bzhin du byis ba dang rgan pa la sogs pa rnams ni nad kyi dbang las chang la sogs pa lkog mar phyin gyi bar du 'thung du bcug la ;
analyzed: de bzhin du byis ba dang rgan pa la sogs pa rnams ni nad kyi dbang las chang la sogs pa lkog mar phyin gyi bar du 'thung du bcug la ;
translated: Likewise, the young and the old and so on should be made to drink wine and so on until it reaches the throat, in accordance with the power of the disease.

original: nad dmigs ji skad bshad cing gang la ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang rgyam tsha dag dang ldan zhing bsres la /
analyzed: nad dmigs ji skad bshad cing gang la ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang rgyam tsha dag dang ldan zhing bsres la /
translated: The honey and salt should be mixed with the disease as explained and as appropriate.

original: sman gyi tshan lto sra snyi rab 'bring tha ma'i tshad las dpags te /
analyzed: sman gyi tshan lto sra snyi rab 'bring tha ma'i tshad las dpags te /
translated: The amount of medicine should be judged according to the strength, medium or weak, of the patient's stomach.

original: lto snyi ba la sman 'jam po'am tshad chung ba'i sman sbyin no //
analyzed: lto snyi ba la sman 'jam po'am tshad chung ba'i sman sbyin no //
translated: If the stomach is weak, give soft or small doses of medicine.

original: 'bring la 'bring ngo //
analyzed: 'bring la 'bring ngo //
translated: If medium, give medium doses.

original: sra ba ni che ba dang che ba'o //
analyzed: sra ba ni che ba dang che ba'o //
translated: If strong, give large or large doses.

original: sman la sngags kyis mngon par bzla ba ni /
analyzed: sman la sngags kyis mngon par bzla ba ni /
translated: As for the recitation of mantras over the medicine,

original: dge slong bram ze rnams kyi shis par brjod par bya ba'i tshig rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ste skye dgu'i bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs @210b pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong bram ze rnams kyi shis par brjod par bya ba'i tshig rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ste skye dgu'i bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs @210b pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: one should recite the auspicious verses of the monks and brahmins, and likewise the verses beginning with Brahma, lord of beings, and so on, and recite the mantras.

original: de la tshangs pa dang skye dgu'i bdag po myur du zhes bya ba dang / tha skar gyi bu gnyis dang / drag po lha chen po dang / dbang po ste brgya byin dang / sa'i lha dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba dang /
analyzed: de la tshangs pa dang skye dgu'i bdag po myur du zhes bya ba dang / tha skar gyi bu gnyis dang / drag po lha chen po dang / dbang po ste brgya byin dang / sa'i lha dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba dang /
translated: Rudra, the great god, Indra, the lord of the gods, the earth goddess, the sun, the moon,

original: me lha dang / rlung lha ste tshangs pa la sogs pa de dag gis khyed la bsrung zhing skyob par shog shig pa'o //
analyzed: me lha dang / rlung lha ste tshangs pa la sogs pa de dag gis khyed la bsrung zhing skyob par shog shig pa'o //
translated: the fire god, and the wind god—may these Brahma and the others protect and guard you.

original: 'di dag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi drang srong zhes bya ba rgyun shes la sogs pa sman gyi tshogs dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi drang srong zhes bya ba rgyun shes la sogs pa sman gyi tshogs dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Not only these, but also the seers, such as Atreya and others, together with the assembly of physicians,

original: sman gyi gnas yul lam sman gyi tshogs du ma dang bcas pa rnams dang / de bzhin du 'byung po'i tshogs te lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang mi'am ci la sogs pa 'byung po mthu bo che rnams kyis bsrung bar shog shig pa'o //
analyzed: sman gyi gnas yul lam sman gyi tshogs du ma dang bcas pa rnams dang / de bzhin du 'byung po'i tshogs te lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang mi'am ci la sogs pa 'byung po mthu bo che rnams kyis bsrung bar shog shig pa'o //
translated: together with the many assemblies of medical knowledge, or the many assemblies of medicine, and likewise the assembly of spirits, such as the demigods, garudas, and kinnaras, may these powerful spirits protect you.

original: yang khyed la sman 'di lta bur nye bar gnas par gyur cig pa ste /
analyzed: yang khyed la sman 'di lta bur nye bar gnas par gyur cig pa ste /
translated: May your medicine be like that of the sages,🔽The sages are those called “transmigrators” and so forth.

original: drang srong rnams kyi bcud len dang / zhes bya ba drang srong 'pho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcud kyis len du byas pa'i sman gyi tshogs lta bu dang / brgya byin la sogs pa lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi lta bu dang / klu yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na /
analyzed: drang srong rnams kyi bcud len dang / zhes bya ba drang srong 'pho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcud kyis len du byas pa'i sman gyi tshogs lta bu dang / brgya byin la sogs pa lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi lta bu dang / klu yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na /
translated: The medicine that they have prepared is like the nectar of Indra and the other gods, and of the supreme nagas.

original: klu mchog ste mtha' yas dang nor rgyas dang rigs ldan la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: klu mchog ste mtha' yas dang nor rgyas dang rigs ldan la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The supreme nagas are Ananta, Vasuki, Takshaka, and so forth.

original: klu rnams kyi bdud rtsi rnyed par sla ba ma yin pas klu mchog ces smos pa yin te /
analyzed: klu rnams kyi bdud rtsi rnyed par sla ba ma yin pas klu mchog ces smos pa yin te /
translated: Since the nectar of the nagas is not easily obtained, it is called “supreme.”

original: klu rnams kyi bdud rtsi ni lha'i bas cung zad dman pa yin te /
analyzed: klu rnams kyi bdud rtsi ni lha'i bas cung zad dman pa yin te /
translated: The nectar of the nagas is slightly inferior to that of the gods.

original: de dang khyed kyi sman 'di 'dra ba nyid du gnas par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dang khyed kyi sman 'di 'dra ba nyid du gnas par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May your medicine be like that.

original: 'thungs nas de la sems dmigs te //
analyzed: 'thungs nas de la sems dmigs te //
translated: Having drunk it, focus your mind on it.

original: yud tsam bsdad la dang gar 'khyil //
analyzed: yud tsam bsdad la dang gar 'khyil //
translated: Stay for a moment and then roll around.

original: mchil ma de las slon du gzhug / ma gnod par ni sor mos sam //
analyzed: mchil ma de las slon du gzhug / ma gnod par ni sor mos sam //
translated: The saliva should be induced to flow, and the patient should be made to swallow it without injury to the throat.

original: yang na chu ba 'jam bo yis //🔽lkog ma lce'u chung ma snad bya //
analyzed: yang na chu ba 'jam bo yis // lkog ma lce'u chung ma snad bya //
translated: He should be made to swallow it with the finger or with a soft stalk.🔽The throat and the palate should not be injured.

original: skyug mi bro bar mi drang ngo //
analyzed: skyug mi bro bar mi drang ngo //
translated: He should not be made to swallow it with a feeling of nausea.

original: 'byung bar ldog pa slon par bya //
analyzed: 'byung bar ldog pa slon par bya //
translated: The patient should be made to swallow it with a feeling of comfort.

original: pus mo dang mnyam stan la gnas //🔽zhes byab la /
analyzed: pus mo dang mnyam stan la gnas // zhes byab la /
translated: He should sit on a seat as high as the knee.

original: sman 'thungs zin nas /
analyzed: sman 'thungs zin nas /
translated: After the medicine has been taken,

original: de la sems shing zhes pa slon bro ba'i sems bskyed la /
analyzed: de la sems shing zhes pa slon bro ba'i sems bskyed la /
translated: he should be made to think of it.

original: yud tsam zhes pa chu tshod gnyis kyi bar du bsdad cing 'dug la dang gar 'khyil ba dang / rdul 'byung @211a * //
analyzed: yud tsam zhes pa chu tshod gnyis kyi bar du bsdad cing 'dug la dang gar 'khyil ba dang / rdul 'byung @211a * //
translated: He should sit for a while, for two hours, and observe whether the medicine has been digested or not.

original: bas nad zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / ba spu ldang bas gnas las bskyod par 'gyur ba dang / khong pa cung zad spo zhing 'khrugs pas ltor rgyu ba dang / rim gyis snying gang zug cing dang ga 'khyil ba dang / snying 'phar ba dang /
analyzed: bas nad zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / ba spu ldang bas gnas las bskyod par 'gyur ba dang / khong pa cung zad spo zhing 'khrugs pas ltor rgyu ba dang / rim gyis snying gang zug cing dang ga 'khyil ba dang / snying 'phar ba dang /
translated: The patient should be made to observe whether the medicine has been digested or not by the following signs: the pacification of the disease, the rising of sweat, the movement of the medicine in the stomach, the throbbing of the heart, the feeling of comfort, the feeling of lightness, the feeling of strength, and the feeling of hunger.

original: mchil ma mang po khar 'byung ba dag gis nad de gyen du mngon par shes pa'i bar du yud tsam bsdad nas slon du gzhug go //
analyzed: mchil ma mang po khar 'byung ba dag gis nad de gyen du mngon par shes pa'i bar du yud tsam bsdad nas slon du gzhug go //
translated: When the patient has a lot of saliva in the mouth, he should be made to swallow it after remaining in that state for a short while.

original: gang la dang ga 'khyil ba dang mchil ma mang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni dang gar 'khyil ba dang / mchil ma mang ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: gang la dang ga 'khyil ba dang mchil ma mang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni dang gar 'khyil ba dang / mchil ma mang ba zhes bya la /
translated: When there is a twisting of the intestines and a lot of saliva, it is called “twisting of the intestines and a lot of saliva.”

original: de ltar gyur nas de slon du gzhug go //
analyzed: de ltar gyur nas de slon du gzhug go //
translated: When that happens, he should be made to swallow.

original: ji ltar slon par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar slon par bya zhe na /
translated: How should he be made to swallow?

original: ma gnod par sor mo gnyis kyis slon zhing drang ba ste /
analyzed: ma gnod par sor mo gnyis kyis slon zhing drang ba ste /
translated: He should be made to swallow without harm, with two fingers.

original: shin tu rtsol ba drag pos mi bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rtsol ba drag pos mi bya'o //
translated: He should not do it with too much strong effort.

original: yang na chu ba 'jam pos bya ste /🔽autpal sngon po la sogs pa'i chu sdong zlum pa 'jam zhing mnyen pas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chu ba 'jam pos bya ste / autpal sngon po la sogs pa'i chu sdong zlum pa 'jam zhing mnyen pas bya'o //
translated: Or he should do it with a soft stalk.🔽He should do it with a soft, round stalk of a blue lotus, etc.

original: lkog ma lce chung ma snad par //
analyzed: lkog ma lce chung ma snad par //
translated: Without injuring the uvula or the epiglottis.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de dag la gnod pa med par ro //
analyzed: de dag la gnod pa med par ro //
translated: Without harming them.

original: de bzhin du skyug mi bro zhing 'byung bar mi ldog pa'i tshe drang zhing slon par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyug mi bro zhing 'byung bar mi ldog pa'i tshe drang zhing slon par mi bya'o //
translated: Likewise, when there is no nausea and no vomiting, he should be made to swallow without injury.

original: skyug bro zhing 'byung bar ldog pa na slon zhing skyug par bya'o //
analyzed: skyug bro zhing 'byung bar ldog pa na slon zhing skyug par bya'o //
translated: When the vomiting is reversed, the patient should be made to vomit.

original: skyes bu slon zhing skyug bro ba'i tshe /🔽pus mo dang mnyam pa'i stan mthon po la gnas par gyur pas skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: skyes bu slon zhing skyug bro ba'i tshe / pus mo dang mnyam pa'i stan mthon po la gnas par gyur pas skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: When the person is vomiting,🔽he should be made to vomit while standing on a high seat even with his knees.

original: de ni slon tshe glo gnyis dang // dpral ba dag la brten par bya //
analyzed: de ni slon tshe glo gnyis dang // dpral ba dag la brten par bya //
translated: When vomiting, he should be supported on both sides of the chest and on the forehead.

original: de bzhin lte ba btsir ba dang // rgyab nas gyen du mnye bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin lte ba btsir ba dang // rgyab nas gyen du mnye bar bya //
translated: Likewise, the navel should be pressed and massaged upwards from behind.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: mi de slon zhing skyugs par gyur pa na /🔽glo gnyis te rtsib logs gnyis dang / de bzhin du dpung pa nas gzung zhing brten par bya'o //
analyzed: mi de slon zhing skyugs par gyur pa na / glo gnyis te rtsib logs gnyis dang / de bzhin du dpung pa nas gzung zhing brten par bya'o //
translated: When that person is vomiting,🔽he should be held and supported on both sides of the chest, that is, on both sides of the ribs, and likewise from the shoulders.

original: de bzhin lte ba btsir bar bya ba dang rgyab nas gyen du btsir thabs kyis phul zhing lag pa gyen du bltas pas mnye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin lte ba btsir bar bya ba dang rgyab nas gyen du btsir thabs kyis phul zhing lag pa gyen du bltas pas mnye bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the navel should be pressed and massaged upwards from behind with the hands turned upwards.

original: de ltar bad kan rno drod kha //
analyzed: de ltar bad kan rno drod kha //
translated: Thus, phlegm is vomited by sharp heat,

original: mkhris pa mngar dang bsil bas slon //
analyzed: mkhris pa mngar dang bsil bas slon //
translated: bile by sweet and cold things.

original: rlung 'dres bad kan snum pa dang // skyur dang lan tshva dag gis slon //🔽ji srid bad kan rgyun chad pa'am //
analyzed: rlung 'dres bad kan snum pa dang // skyur dang lan tshva dag gis slon // ji srid bad kan rgyun chad pa'am //
translated: The wind is mixed with phlegm, and is soaked with oiliness, sourness, and saltiness.🔽As long as the phlegm is not stopped,

original: mkhris pa snang gi bar du skyug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris pa snang gi bar du skyug / ces bya ba la /
translated: or the bile is not seen.

original: tshul de ltar bad kan ni sman rno ba dang dro ba dang kha bas slon zhing skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: tshul de ltar bad kan ni sman rno ba dang dro ba dang kha bas slon zhing skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: In that way, the phlegm is soaked and made to be vomited by sharp, hot, and sour medicines.

original: de bzhin du mkhris pa dang bad kan @211b rgyas pa 'dres pa'i nad la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhris pa dang bad kan @211b rgyas pa 'dres pa'i nad la /
translated: Similarly, in a disease of mixed bile and increased phlegm,

original: sman mngar ba dang bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pas slon du gzhug go //
analyzed: sman mngar ba dang bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pas slon du gzhug go //
translated: it is soaked with sweet and cool medicines.

original: de bzhin du rlung nad 'dres shing 'dus pa'i bad kan rgyas pa la ni sman snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i shas che ba dag gis slon du gzhug go //🔽de slon pa ni ji srid bad kan zad cing rgyun chad pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung nad 'dres shing 'dus pa'i bad kan rgyas pa la ni sman snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i shas che ba dag gis slon du gzhug go // de slon pa ni ji srid bad kan zad cing rgyun chad pa'am /
translated: Similarly, in a wind disease mixed with increased phlegm, it is soaked with oily, sour, and salty medicines.🔽That soaking is vomited and drawn out as long as the phlegm is exhausted and stopped,

original: mkhris pa snang gi bar du skyug cing drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa snang gi bar du skyug cing drang bar bya'o //
translated: or the bile is seen.

original: shugs dal pi pi ling skyu ru //
analyzed: shugs dal pi pi ling skyu ru //
translated: Slow strength, pippali, and āmalaka,

original: yungs kar rgyam tsha'i chu dag gis //
analyzed: yungs kar rgyam tsha'i chu dag gis //
translated: Then, with mustard seed, rock salt, and water,

original: yang dang yang ni slon du gzhug / ces bya ba la /🔽skyes bu slon pa'i shugs dal zhing /
analyzed: yang dang yang ni slon du gzhug / ces bya ba la / skyes bu slon pa'i shugs dal zhing /
translated: induce vomiting again and again.🔽If the strength of vomiting in a person is slow

original: babs chung bar gyur na /
analyzed: babs chung bar gyur na /
translated: and weak,

original: pi pi ling dang yungs kar btags pa'i lde gu dang / rgyam tsha'i chu dag blud la /
analyzed: pi pi ling dang yungs kar btags pa'i lde gu dang / rgyam tsha'i chu dag blud la /
translated: give a paste of Pippali and mustard seed, and water with rock salt,

original: de yang dang yang du slon zhing skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: de yang dang yang du slon zhing skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: and induce vomiting again and again.

original: der ni slon par ma gyur pa'am //
analyzed: der ni slon par ma gyur pa'am //
translated: If there is no vomiting there,

original: sdod pa dang bcas slon pa'am //
analyzed: sdod pa dang bcas slon pa'am //
translated: or if there is vomiting with retention,

original: sman ni 'ba' zhig byung gyur na //
analyzed: sman ni 'ba' zhig byung gyur na //
translated: or if only medicine comes up,

original: sbyor nyes de ni mchil ma mang //
analyzed: sbyor nyes de ni mchil ma mang //
translated: that is a fault of the compound.

original: g-yan pa thor bu rim sogs 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yan pa thor bu rim sogs 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Itching, pustules, and so forth occur.

original: skyug pa'i gnas skabs der slon pa'i shugs ci'ang 'byung bar ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: skyug pa'i gnas skabs der slon pa'i shugs ci'ang 'byung bar ma gyur pa'am /
translated: If in that situation of vomiting, the strength of vomiting does not occur at all,

original: yang na sdod pa'i gags dang bcas par slon pa'am /
analyzed: yang na sdod pa'i gags dang bcas par slon pa'am /
translated: or if there is vomiting with an obstruction of retention,

original: sman 'ba' zhig byung bar gyur zhing nad ma phyin pa sman nyi tshe skyugs par gyur na /
analyzed: sman 'ba' zhig byung bar gyur zhing nad ma phyin pa sman nyi tshe skyugs par gyur na /
translated: or if only medicine comes up and the disease does not go, and only medicine is vomited,

original: 'di ni skyug sman gyi sbyor ba nyes shing ma rungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyug sman gyi sbyor ba nyes shing ma rungs pa yin te /
translated: This is a bad preparation of emetic medicine.

original: sbyor ba nyes pa des mchil ma mang ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes pa des mchil ma mang ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that bad preparation, much saliva, etc. arise.

original: mchil ma ni bad kan mchil sna bas mang du 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: mchil ma ni bad kan mchil sna bas mang du 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Saliva is the excessive flow of phlegm and mucus.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / lus lci ba dang tshigs na ba dang / rmya zhing snyom pa dang zug cing gzer ba dang / spu langs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / lus lci ba dang tshigs na ba dang / rmya zhing snyom pa dang zug cing gzer ba dang / spu langs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes unpleasantness, heaviness of the body, pain in the joints, emaciation, exhaustion, pain, horripilation, etc.

original: bder skyug bad kan mkhris pa dang // rlung ni rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽sbyor ba legs pa yin //
analyzed: bder skyug bad kan mkhris pa dang // rlung ni rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur // sbyor ba legs pa yin //
translated: Emesis is good when it occurs easily, in sequence, and with phlegm, bile, and wind.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is a good preparation.

original: skyug sman gyi sbyor ba legs pa'i mtshan ma yang bde bar skyug cing gzer ba dang / bad kan la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyug sman gyi sbyor ba legs pa'i mtshan ma yang bde bar skyug cing gzer ba dang / bad kan la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Here, the signs of a good preparation of emetic medicine are: emesis occurs easily, without pain, and in sequence with phlegm, etc.

original: bad kan slon pa med par 'byung ba dang / de'i 'og tu mkhris pa /
analyzed: bad kan slon pa med par 'byung ba dang / de'i 'og tu mkhris pa /
translated: Phlegm comes out without obstruction, then bile,

original: de'i 'og tu rlung rim bzhin du 'byung ba dang / @212a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rlung rim bzhin du 'byung ba dang / @212a * //

translated: In the evening, one should eat the food of the regular meal.

analyzed: de bzhin du sbyang ba tha mas sbyangs pas zas kyi dus gcig tu thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa spyad par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, by the small purification, one should practice the one time of food, such as the soup, and so on.

original: nyin zhag dang po'i dgongs ka thug pa rkyang rkyang po spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag dang po'i dgongs ka thug pa rkyang rkyang po spyad par bya'o //
translated: In the evening of the first day, one should drink the soup of the soup.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa'i nang par thug pa gar po dgongs ka g-yos su ma byas pa'i sha nyi ma gsum pa'i nang bar g-yos su bya ba'i khu ba /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa'i nang par thug pa gar po dgongs ka g-yos su ma byas pa'i sha nyi ma gsum pa'i nang bar g-yos su bya ba'i khu ba /
translated: On the second day, the thick soup is the meat that was not cooked the previous evening. On the third day, the soup is the meat that was cooked the previous evening.

original: dgongs ka sha khu de phan chad ni zas nar ma thams cad spyad la rag go //
analyzed: dgongs ka sha khu de phan chad ni zas nar ma thams cad spyad la rag go //
translated: From then on, all the regular foods are used.

original: thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa'i rim pas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa'i rim pas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the stages of the single thick soup and so on?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni //🔽dper na me chung rtsva dang lci sogs kyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni // dper na me chung rtsva dang lci sogs kyis //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽For example, a small fire

original: rnam par sbar nas rim gyis mched pa na //
analyzed: rnam par sbar nas rim gyis mched pa na //
translated: is gradually increased by kindling and so on.

original: che zhing brtan la thams cad mched par nus //🔽sbyangs pa'i nad med thug sogs kyis de bzhin //
analyzed: che zhing brtan la thams cad mched par nus // sbyangs pa'i nad med thug sogs kyis de bzhin //
translated: It becomes great, stable and able to spread everywhere.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The same is true of the sick person without training and the thick soup and so on.

original: dper na me shing med cing phra ba cung zad cig gnas par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dper na me shing med cing phra ba cung zad cig gnas par gyur pa ni /
translated: For example, a small fire that is not fed with fuel remains small.

original: rtsva dang lci ba la sogs pa phra zhing zhib mor rnam par sbar zhing 'bud pa na /
analyzed: rtsva dang lci ba la sogs pa phra zhing zhib mor rnam par sbar zhing 'bud pa na /
translated: But when it is gradually increased by kindling and so on that is fine and thin,

original: rim gyis mched par gyur pa na chen por 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du brtan zhing mi sod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mched par nus pa @214a * //
analyzed: rim gyis mched par gyur pa na chen por 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du brtan zhing mi sod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mched par nus pa @214a * //
translated: Similarly, it becomes stable and strong, and is able to digest everything.

original: ste ; dngos po sra zhing lci ba'i zas kyi rigs rnams kyang smin pa dang tshos par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ste ; dngos po sra zhing lci ba'i zas kyi rigs rnams kyang smin pa dang tshos par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even hard and heavy foods are able to be digested and cooked.

original: de bzhin du sbyangs par gyur pa'i pho ba'i nang gi me sbyangs pas nyam chung zhing stobs zhan pa thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pas gsos par gyur pa ni rim gyis che ba dang brtan pa dang / 'ju zhing smin par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyangs par gyur pa'i pho ba'i nang gi me sbyangs pas nyam chung zhing stobs zhan pa thug pa rkyang rkyang po la sogs pas gsos par gyur pa ni rim gyis che ba dang brtan pa dang / 'ju zhing smin par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the fire in the stomach, which has been purified by purification, gradually becomes great, stable, and able to digest and cook, even if one is nourished by thin gruel and so forth, which is weak and has little strength.

original: de la sbyang ba gsum po de gang zhig yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyang ba gsum po de gang zhig yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what are those three purifications,

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: it is said:

original: slon tshad chung dang 'bring dang chen po ni //
analyzed: slon tshad chung dang 'bring dang chen po ni //
translated: The measure of eating is small, medium, and great.

original: bzhi dang drug dang lan brgyad slon par 'dod //
analyzed: bzhi dang drug dang lan brgyad slon par 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that one eats four, six, and eight times.

original: de gnyis bcu dang nyis ldab sum ldab 'khru //
analyzed: de gnyis bcu dang nyis ldab sum ldab 'khru //
translated: Those two are doubled and tripled.

original: bre gang de bzhin nyis ldab bzhi ldab 'gyur //
analyzed: bre gang de bzhin nyis ldab bzhi ldab 'gyur //
translated: A pint is doubled and quadrupled.

original: skyug sman mthar mkhris bkru sman las byed dang // bad kan mthar byung 'khru ba mchog tu bshad //
analyzed: skyug sman mthar mkhris bkru sman las byed dang // bad kan mthar byung 'khru ba mchog tu bshad //
translated: Vomiting medicine, at the end of bile, purgation medicine, and at the end of phlegm, is said to be the best.🔽Thus, the small, medium, and great measures are respectively four, six, and eight times the dose.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po go rims ji lta ba bzhin du slon shugs bzhi dang / drug dang brgyad slon pa dag tshe'i rig byed dran par byed pa dag mngon bar 'dod cing ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po go rims ji lta ba bzhin du slon shugs bzhi dang / drug dang brgyad slon pa dag tshe'i rig byed dran par byed pa dag mngon bar 'dod cing ston pa yin no //
translated: The Carakas state that this is remembered and taught in the Ayurveda.

original: de la slon pa chung tshad ni lan bzhi slon pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la slon pa chung tshad ni lan bzhi slon pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: There, the small measure of the dose is considered to be four times.

original: slon tshad 'bring ni lan drug slon pa'o //
analyzed: slon tshad 'bring ni lan drug slon pa'o //
translated: The medium measure of the dose is six times.

original: slon pa che tshad ni lan brgyad slon pa'o //
analyzed: slon pa che tshad ni lan brgyad slon pa'o //
translated: The great measure of the dose is eight times.

original: 'byung ba'i shugs de nyid bcu dang nyis ldab dang / sum ldab ni 'khru ba'i tshad chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po yin par drang srong nyid 'dod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i shugs de nyid bcu dang nyis ldab dang / sum ldab ni 'khru ba'i tshad chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po yin par drang srong nyid 'dod do //
translated: The sage himself asserts that the strength of the humors is ten, twelve, and thirty times the amount of the small, medium, and great measures of emesis.

original: de la 'khru ba chung ba'i tshad ni lan bcu 'khru ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'khru ba chung ba'i tshad ni lan bcu 'khru ba'o //
translated: The measure of small emesis is ten times.

original: 'khru ba'i 'bring tshad ni /
analyzed: 'khru ba'i 'bring tshad ni /
translated: The measure of medium emesis

original: bcu gnyis ldab ste lan nyi shu 'khru bar 'dod do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis ldab ste lan nyi shu 'khru bar 'dod do //
translated: is twelve times, asserted to be twenty times.

original: 'khru ba che tshad ni bcu'i sum ldab sum cu yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'khru ba che tshad ni bcu'i sum ldab sum cu yin par 'dod do //
translated: The measure of great emesis is thirty times, asserted to be thirty times.

original: de ltar na skyug sman dang bkru sman gnyis kyi 'byung ba'i grangs kyi tshad chung ngu dang chen po bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skyug sman dang bkru sman gnyis kyi 'byung ba'i grangs kyi tshad chung ngu dang chen po bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the small and great measures of the number of humors in both emetics and purgatives have been explained.

original: bre la sogs pa'i tshad kyis gzhal ba'i tshad chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po smras pa ni bre gang la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bre la sogs pa'i tshad kyis gzhal ba'i tshad chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po smras pa ni bre gang la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The small, medium, and great measures of evaluation by the measures of dre and so on are one dre and so forth.

original: 'khru ba'i tshad chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni rim bzhin du bre gang dang / de nyid kyis nyis ldab dang / de nyid kyis bzhi ldab yin no //
analyzed: 'khru ba'i tshad chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni rim bzhin du bre gang dang / de nyid kyis nyis ldab dang / de nyid kyis bzhi ldab yin no //
translated: The small, medium and great doses of emetic medicine are respectively one, two and four drona.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the connection.

original: des na 'khru ba chung tshad ni bre gang ngo //
analyzed: des na 'khru ba chung tshad ni bre gang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the small dose of emetic medicine is one drona.

original: 'bring ni bre do'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni bre do'o //
translated: The medium dose is two dronom

original: @214b chen po ni bre bzhi yin no //
analyzed: @214b chen po ni bre bzhi yin no //
translated: The great dose is four dronom

original: slob dpon gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan dag ni /
translated: Other masters say:

original: skyug sman gyi mchog ni mkhris pa 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: skyug sman gyi mchog ni mkhris pa 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The best emetic medicine is that which ends with the arising of bile.

original: skyug sman gang gi mthar mkhris pa 'byung ba de ni /🔽skyug sman mthar ni mkhris pa'o //
analyzed: skyug sman gang gi mthar mkhris pa 'byung ba de ni / skyug sman mthar ni mkhris pa'o //
translated: That emetic medicine which ends with the arising of bile🔽is called emetic medicine that ends with bile.

original: zhes bya'o // bkru sman gyi tshad bre gang du yongs su chung ba las phyed do //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // bkru sman gyi tshad bre gang du yongs su chung ba las phyed do //
translated: The measure of emetic medicine is one drona, half of which is the small dose.

original: des na slon pa'i chung tshad ni bre phyed do //🔽'bring ni bre gang ngo //
analyzed: des na slon pa'i chung tshad ni bre phyed do // 'bring ni bre gang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the small dose of emetic medicine is half a drona.🔽The medium dose is one drona.

original: che tshad ni bre do'o //
analyzed: che tshad ni bre do'o //
translated: The great dose is two dronom

original: de bzhin du bad kan mtha' mar byung ba'i 'khru ba'i tshad ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan mtha' mar byung ba'i 'khru ba'i tshad ni mchog yin no //
translated: Similarly, the best measure of diarrhea that occurs at the end of phlegm is the supreme.

original: zhes srog bsrung ba'i slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes srog bsrung ba'i slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained by the masters who protect life.

original: 'khru ba gnyis gsum bshad dang bcas mi gtogs //
analyzed: 'khru ba gnyis gsum bshad dang bcas mi gtogs //
translated: Two or three diarrhea are not included in the explanation.

original: 'khru ba gzhal te slon pa 'thungs ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'khru ba gzhal te slon pa 'thungs ma gtogs //
translated: Do not drink a decoction after measuring diarrhea.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this,

original: 'bring ni bre gang ngo //
analyzed: 'bring ni bre gang ngo //
translated: the medium is one dre.

original: 'khru ba'i shugs gnyis sam gsum la ni 'khru ba'i gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khru ba'i shugs gnyis sam gsum la ni 'khru ba'i gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: In two or three diarrhea forces, it is called three diarrhea.

original: de bshang ba dang bcas par 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de bshang ba dang bcas par 'byung bas na /
translated: Since that occurs together with feces,

original: bshang bcas te 'khru ba de gtogs shing tshad du bgrang bar mi rtsi zhing 'khru ba'i tshad la la gzhal zhing brtsis la 'khru ba'i grangs su bstan pa gang yin pa las de mi rtsi ste /
analyzed: bshang bcas te 'khru ba de gtogs shing tshad du bgrang bar mi rtsi zhing 'khru ba'i tshad la la gzhal zhing brtsis la 'khru ba'i grangs su bstan pa gang yin pa las de mi rtsi ste /
translated: that diarrhea together with feces is included and not counted in the measure. In the measure of diarrhea that is measured and counted, whatever is taught as the number of diarrhea, that is not counted.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po'i rigs gzhan de med pa 'khru ba'i shugs kyi dbang gis bshad ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba de nyid de'i 'og tu bre la sogs pa'i chad kyis gzhal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po'i rigs gzhan de med pa 'khru ba'i shugs kyi dbang gis bshad ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba de nyid de'i 'og tu bre la sogs pa'i chad kyis gzhal bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the other substance that follows it is to be measured by the cup, etc., by the force of the expulsion of the undigested matter.

original: de bzhin du slon zhing skyugs pa'i lus la slon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du slon zhing skyugs pa'i lus la slon pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, what is drunk and vomited is not counted in the number explained, because it is drunk and vomited in the body.

original: skyug sman chu la sogs pa rdzas gsher ba dang bsres te 'thungs pa gang yin pa kha nas slon te byung ba de skad du bshad pa'i grangs su mi rtsi'o //
analyzed: skyug sman chu la sogs pa rdzas gsher ba dang bsres te 'thungs pa gang yin pa kha nas slon te byung ba de skad du bshad pa'i grangs su mi rtsi'o //
translated: What is drunk mixed with a liquid substance such as water, etc., for the purpose of vomiting, and comes out of the mouth, is not counted in the number explained.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po gzhan dag slon pa'i shugs kyis kha'i sgo nas byung ba de nyid phan chad gzhal zhing brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po gzhan dag slon pa'i shugs kyis kha'i sgo nas byung ba de nyid phan chad gzhal zhing brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the other substances that follow it, which come out of the mouth by the force of the expulsion, are to be measured and counted from that point on.

original: de nas slon pa de la ni //
analyzed: de nas slon pa de la ni //
translated: Then, for that vomiting,

original: slar yang snum dang dugs byas te //
analyzed: slar yang snum dang dugs byas te //
translated: again do unction and fomentation.

original: bad kan dus 'das lto shes nas //
analyzed: bad kan dus 'das lto shes nas //
translated: Knowing the time of phlegm has passed,

original: legs par bkru sman gtang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: legs par bkru sman gtang bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: administer a good purgative.🔽As for that,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “then” means

original: bkra shis pa'i don nam /
analyzed: bkra shis pa'i don nam /
translated: in the sense of auspiciousness,🔽or

original: de ma thag pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of “immediately after” is as follows.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu slon pa'i skyes bu de slar yang zhes bya ba phyis yang snum dang dugs byas shing bde bar gnas pa sngar bshad pa'i chogs byas la /🔽bad kan gyi dus 'das pa dang lto na kha zas @215a * //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu slon pa'i skyes bu de slar yang zhes bya ba phyis yang snum dang dugs byas shing bde bar gnas pa sngar bshad pa'i chogs byas la / bad kan gyi dus 'das pa dang lto na kha zas @215a * //
translated: Then, after that, the student, the person, again, later, having been massaged and steamed, and having rested comfortably, having performed the previously explained rites,

original: med par shes shing rtogs nas sman gyi tshad ji ltar 'os pa las legs par bkru sman btang zhing 'thung du bcug la /
analyzed: med par shes shing rtogs nas sman gyi tshad ji ltar 'os pa las legs par bkru sman btang zhing 'thung du bcug la /
translated: when the time for phlegm has passed, and when he knows and understands that there is no food in the stomach, he should be given a good purgative, the proper amount of medicine, and made to drink it.

original: 'khru bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khru bar bya'o //
translated: He should be purged.

original: mkhris pa mang zhing lto snyi la //
analyzed: mkhris pa mang zhing lto snyi la //
translated: If there is an excess of bile and the stomach is soft,

original: 'o mas kyang ni 'khru bar byed //
analyzed: 'o mas kyang ni 'khru bar byed //
translated: he should be purged with milk.

original: rlung shas che zhing lto sran //
analyzed: rlung shas che zhing lto sran //
translated: If there is an excess of wind and the stomach is hard,

original: dur byid sogs kyis kyang 'khru dka' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dur byid sogs kyis kyang 'khru dka' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is difficult to purge him with castor oil, etc.

original: de la mkhris pa mang zhing lto snyi ba gang yin ba de ni 'o mas kyang 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: de la mkhris pa mang zhing lto snyi ba gang yin ba de ni 'o mas kyang 'khru bar byed do //
translated: With regard to that, if there is an excess of bile and the stomach is soft, he should be purged with milk.

original: 'dir 'o ma smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir 'o ma smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The mention of milk here is merely an illustration.

original: des na bu ram shing gi khu ba dang dar ba skyur po dang / zho ga chu dang / bu ram dang / kri sar dang / zhun mar dang / chang dang / chu tshan dang / pi lu dang / rgun 'brum dang / gla gor zho sha la sogs pas kyang 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: des na bu ram shing gi khu ba dang dar ba skyur po dang / zho ga chu dang / bu ram dang / kri sar dang / zhun mar dang / chang dang / chu tshan dang / pi lu dang / rgun 'brum dang / gla gor zho sha la sogs pas kyang 'khru bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, one should also use sugarcane juice, sour gruel, curd, water, molasses, milk, ghee, wine, hot water, pilu, grapes, and sugarcane, etc.

original: de la rlung shas che zhing lto sra la 'khru bar dka' ba ni dur byid dang 'bras bu gsum dang / nim pa dang / ni li ni dang / da na da'i 'bras bu la sogs pas kyang 'khru bar dka' zhing rtsol ba chen pos gdong 'khru ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung shas che zhing lto sra la 'khru bar dka' ba ni dur byid dang 'bras bu gsum dang / nim pa dang / ni li ni dang / da na da'i 'bras bu la sogs pas kyang 'khru bar dka' zhing rtsol ba chen pos gdong 'khru ba yin no //
translated: If the patient has a predominance of vata, a hard stomach, and difficulty in defecating, then even with haritaki, triphala, nimba, nilika, danti fruit, etc., defecation is difficult and one must strain greatly to defecate.

original: bkru sman mkhris la mngar dang bska //
analyzed: bkru sman mkhris la mngar dang bska //
translated: Medicines for purgation are sweet for pitta,

original: bad kan la ni kha bas bya //
analyzed: bad kan la ni kha bas bya //
translated: sour for kapha,

original: rlung la snum dro lan tshva can //
analyzed: rlung la snum dro lan tshva can //
translated: and unctuous, warm, and salty for vata.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: mkhris pa'i nad kyi yul la ni bkru sman mngar ba dang / bska ba btang na bkru ba la bsngags so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i nad kyi yul la ni bkru sman mngar ba dang / bska ba btang na bkru ba la bsngags so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: In a country where there is a predominance of bile disorders, it is recommended to use sweet and astringent purgatives.

original: de bzhin du bad kan zhes bya ba la mkhris pa rgyas pa dang 'dres pa'i bad kan la ni sman kha bas bkru ba bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan zhes bya ba la mkhris pa rgyas pa dang 'dres pa'i bad kan la ni sman kha bas bkru ba bsngags pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the case of phlegm disorders, it is recommended to use bitter purgatives for phlegm mixed with an excess of bile.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa 'dres pa la ni sman snum pa dang / dro ba dang / lan tshva can gyi bkru sman gyis bkru ba bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa 'dres pa la ni sman snum pa dang / dro ba dang / lan tshva can gyi bkru sman gyis bkru ba bsngags pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a combination of wind and bile, it is recommended to use oily, warm, and salty purgatives.

original: mi 'khru na ni chu tshan blud //
analyzed: mi 'khru na ni chu tshan blud //
translated: If there is no purging, then hot water should be given.

original: lag pa bsros pas de yi ni //
analyzed: lag pa bsros pas de yi ni //
translated: By warming the hands,

original: lto ba legs par dugs bya'o //
analyzed: lto ba legs par dugs bya'o //
translated: the abdomen should be well steamed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what it says.

original: sbyang ba'i sman gyis 'khru bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: sbyang ba'i sman gyis 'khru bar ma gyur na /
translated: If there is no purging with the purgative medicine,

original: sman gyi nus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sman gyi nus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to increase the potency of the medicine,

original: chu tshan blud pa dang / de bzhin du skyes bu lag pa bsros pas de'i lto ba legs par dugs bya zhing bsro bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshan blud pa dang / de bzhin du skyes bu lag pa bsros pas de'i lto ba legs par dugs bya zhing bsro bar bya'o //
translated: hot water should be given. Similarly, by warming the hands of a person, the abdomen should be well steamed and heated.

original: ma 'khrus de zhag ldang zas zos //
analyzed: ma 'khrus de zhag ldang zas zos //
translated: If it does not purge, then after a day he may eat food.

original: nyi ma gnyis par slar yang btung //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis par slar yang btung //
translated: On the second day, he should drink it again.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: sman des cung zhig 'khru ba'i nad bde mor ma phyin na mal nas @215b langs la /
analyzed: sman des cung zhig 'khru ba'i nad bde mor ma phyin na mal nas @215b langs la /

analyzed: mchil ma mang dang shin tu sbom // lto na srin yod rlung 'khyims dang // dug dag 'thungs dang 'brum bus btab // rkang bam lkog ma'i lba ba can //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la / 'jam rtsi mi bya ba'i yul yang /

analyzed: rlung 'khyims pa ni tshil gyi nang du zhen pa'i rlung ngo //

analyzed: 'brum bu ni 'bras kyi phreng ba'o //
translated: A boil is a series of abscesses.🔽The tube for those two is made of gold, etc.,

analyzed: de gnyis sbu gu gser sogs dang // shing rus 'od ma las byas pa //

analyzed: ba lang mjug 'dra bug rdol med //
translated: It is like a cow’s tail, without holes,

analyzed: 'jam zhing drang la kha zlum pa // zhes bya ba la / bkru sman @221a * // drag po mas gtong ba dang / 'jam rtsi btang ba de gnyis kyi sbu gu ni 'di ltar bya ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs ni ba lang gi mjug ma ltar rim gyis phra ba'o //

original: bug rdol med pa ni spel med pa'o //
analyzed: bug rdol med pa ni spel med pa'o //

original: 'jam pa ni rtsub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni rtsub pa med pa'o //

original: drang ba ni ma yo ba'o //
analyzed: drang ba ni ma yo ba'o //

original: kha zlum pa ni rtse mo mi rno ba'o //
analyzed: kha zlum pa ni rtse mo mi rno ba'o //

original: lo gcig ma lon par sor lnga //
analyzed: lo gcig ma lon par sor lnga //

original: lo tshad lo bdun pa yi bar //
analyzed: lo tshad lo bdun pa yi bar //

original: tshad ni sor drug yin par bshad //
analyzed: tshad ni sor drug yin par bshad //

original: lo bdun pa yi bdun nyid de //
analyzed: lo bdun pa yi bdun nyid de //

original: bcu gnyis pa la sor brgyad bya //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la sor brgyad bya //

original: bcu drug yan chad sor dgu ste //
analyzed: bcu drug yan chad sor dgu ste //

original: nyi shu yan chod sor bcu gnyis //
analyzed: nyi shu yan chod sor bcu gnyis //

analyzed: lo gzhan dag la na tshod dang // stobs dang lus tshad brtags nas ni //
translated: For other ages, the length, strength, and body size of the child should be examined,

original: tshad ni mngon par bskyed par bya //
analyzed: tshad ni mngon par bskyed par bya //
translated: and the tube should be made accordingly.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

analyzed: byis pa lo gcig ma lon pa la gtong ba'i sbu gu ni srid sor lnga bya'o //
translated: For a child less than one year old, the tube for vomiting should be five finger-widths long.

analyzed: lo tshang ste lo gcig lon pa'i byis pa nas lo bdun pa'i bar gyi byis pa'i gce'u'i tshad ni sor drug pa bya ba yin par bshad do //

original: de nas byis pa lo drug lon pa la gce'u sor drug pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas byis pa lo drug lon pa la gce'u sor drug pa bya'o //

original: lo bdun rdzogs pa'i tshe ni sor bdun pa nyid bya'o //
analyzed: lo bdun rdzogs pa'i tshe ni sor bdun pa nyid bya'o //
translated: When seven years have passed, the uvula should be seven finger-widths.

original: lo bcu gnyis lon pa la ni gce'u sor brgyad pa bya'o //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis lon pa la ni gce'u sor brgyad pa bya'o //
translated: When twelve years have passed, the uvula should be eight finger-widths.

original: lo bcu drug lon pa nas lo bcu dgu lon pa'i bar la gce'u sor dgu pa bya'o //
analyzed: lo bcu drug lon pa nas lo bcu dgu lon pa'i bar la gce'u sor dgu pa bya'o //

original: lo nyi shu lon pa phan chad ni gce'u sor bcu gnyis pa bya la /
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon pa phan chad ni gce'u sor bcu gnyis pa bya la /
translated: When nineteen years have passed, the uvula should be twelve finger-widths.

analyzed: yang lo gzhan de dag gi tshe na stobs dang lus kyi tshad brtags nas gce'u'i tshad mngon bar skyed cing 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the length of the uvula should be increased and extended by examining the strength and size of the body at those other ages.

analyzed: de yang lo gcig ma lon pa la gce'u'i tshad sor lnga bya bar bshad la /

original: de rdzogs nas lo bcu drug lon pa'i bar la sor drug bya bar bshad pas /
analyzed: de rdzogs nas lo bcu drug lon pa'i bar la sor drug bya bar bshad pas /
translated: It is explained that when that is complete, the uvula should be six finger-widths for those up to sixteen years old.

original: de'i lo gzhan dag la ni tshod gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du stobs dang lus kyi tshad de brtags te bar skabs der na tshod la sogs ba skye ba bzhin du gce'u yang bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lo gzhan dag la ni tshod gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du stobs dang lus kyi tshad de brtags te bar skabs der na tshod la sogs ba skye ba bzhin du gce'u yang bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at those other ages, the length of the uvula should be increased in the interim, like the growth of age and so on, by examining the strength and size of the body.

analyzed: de bzhin du lo gzhan dag ni na tshod kyi bar gyi lo la yang bsgre bar bya'o // rtsa ba @221b rang gi mthe bong mnyam //
translated: Likewise, the other years should be applied to the years in between the ages.🔽The base is the size of one's thumb.

analyzed: rtse mo mthe'u chung tshad du bya // zhes bya ba la / gce'u'i rtsa ba'i gnas su rang gi mthe bo'i tshad ces pa / nad pa'i mthe bong dang sbom gyi tshad mnyam par bya'o //
translated: The tip is the size of the little finger.🔽The base of the tube is the size of one's thumb.🔽The base of the tube is the size of one's thumb, which is the same as the thickness of the patient's thumb.

original: rtse mo ste gce'u'i kha'i phyogs nad pa'i mthe'u chung dang sbom mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ste gce'u'i kha'i phyogs nad pa'i mthe'u chung dang sbom mnyam par bya'o //
translated: The tip, that is, the mouth of the tube, is the same as the thickness of the patient's little finger.

original: lo gcig lon sor nas gzung ste //
analyzed: lo gcig lon sor nas gzung ste //
translated: Beginning from one year,

original: de yi phyed phyed kyis bskyed bya //
analyzed: de yi phyed phyed kyis bskyed bya //
translated: it should be increased by half a finger joint.

original: gang zhig rtsa ba'i bu ga'i tshad //
analyzed: gang zhig rtsa ba'i bu ga'i tshad //
translated: The best size of the base hole

original: sor mo gsum rtse shong ba mchog / mungga ma sha sran ma btsos //
analyzed: sor mo gsum rtse shong ba mchog / mungga ma sha sran ma btsos //
translated: is three finger joints, which can accommodate the tip of a mung bean.

analyzed: rgya shug 'bras shong rim bzhin bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be the size of a cooked pea, a jujube fruit, or a grape, respectively.

analyzed: na tshod ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas gce'u'i tshad bstan pa'i rim pa las ma 'chol bar byas /
translated: The size of the tube should not be mixed up with the sequence of the ages as explained.

original: byis pa lo gcig lon zhing tshang ba'i sor tshad nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byis pa lo gcig lon zhing tshang ba'i sor tshad nas bzung ste /
translated: Beginning from the size of a one-year-old child,

original: de'i phyed phyed bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyed phyed bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: it should be increased by half a finger joint each year.

original: ji srid du bu gsor gsum par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid du bu gsor gsum par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bskyed par bya ste /
translated: It should be increased until the child is three years old.

original: de ni bu ga'i che tshad ste mchog yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni bu ga'i che tshad ste mchog yin pas na /
translated: This is the best size for the hole.

original: de las kyang lhag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de las kyang lhag par mi bya ste /

analyzed: lo gcig ma lon pa la ni rtsa ba'i bu ga sor gcig pas chung bar bya'o //
translated: For a child less than one year old, the hole should be smaller than one finger joint.

original: rtse mo yang sran mungga shong ba bas cung zad chung bar bya /
analyzed: rtse mo yang sran mungga shong ba bas cung zad chung bar bya /
translated: The tip should be slightly smaller than a pea.

original: de'i phyed phyed ces bya ba la /🔽de yi zhes bya ba ni sor tshad la snyegs la /🔽des na sor gyi phyed phyed kyis bskyed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyed phyed ces bya ba la / de yi zhes bya ba ni sor tshad la snyegs la / des na sor gyi phyed phyed kyis bskyed cing /
translated: Half of that

original: 'phel bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phel bar bya ba ni /
translated: means that the hole should be increased by half a finger joint each year.

original: ji srid rtsa ba'i bu gar sor gsum shong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid rtsa ba'i bu gar sor gsum shong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bskyed par bya'o //
translated: It should be increased until the hole can accommodate three finger joints.

original: rtse mo'i bu ga ni lo gcig lon pa'i gce'u'i bu ga sran mungga ste /
analyzed: rtse mo'i bu ga ni lo gcig lon pa'i gce'u'i bu ga sran mungga ste /
translated: The hole at the tip should be the size of the hole in a one-year-old child’s finger, which can accommodate a pea.

analyzed: mon sran sde'u shong ba nas rgya shug gi bar du rim bzhin du bskyed par bya'o //

original: mchog ces bya ba ni 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /

analyzed: gang rgya shug gi 'bras bu shong ba'i tshad du byas pa'i gce'u'i bu ga ni che tshad yin pas de las lhag par ni mi bya'o //
translated: The size of the hole of the tube should be made the size of a jujube fruit, and it should not be made larger than that.

analyzed: de bas na lo gcig lon pa nas lo drug pa'i bar gyi gce'u'i rtse mo'i bu ga'i tshad ni mungga shong ba tsam bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the size of the hole of the tube for those who have completed one year up to six years should be made the size of a sesame seed.

analyzed: lo bdun pa nas lo bcu gcig pa'i bar gyi gce'u'i bu ga ni ma sha shong ba'o //

analyzed: lo bcu gnyis pa nas bcva lnga'i bar gyi ni sran ma skam po shong ba'o //

analyzed: @222a * // lo bcu drug pa nas bcu dgu pa'i bar du ni sran ma btsos ba shong ba'o //

analyzed: nyi shu lon pa yan chad ni gce'u'i bu ga ni rgya shug gi 'bras bu chung du shong ba tsam bya'o //

analyzed: rtsa ba'i bu ga'i tshad kyi ni //

analyzed: mthar ni bu ga 'gegs par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is to be closed at the end.

analyzed: mthar zhes bya ba rtse mor rtsa ba'i bu ga'i tshad ji lta ba las de'i gag pa 'khor lo lta bu gang shing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Here, “at the end” means at the tip. The size of the opening at the base is to be closed by a cap shaped like a wheel.

translated: “The tip is closed” means that the tip of the tube is covered with a piece of cloth, like the stalk of a cotton plant.

original: rlung la sogs pa nang du zhugs pa dgag pa'i phyir de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa nang du zhugs pa dgag pa'i phyir de ltar bya'o //
translated: This is to be done in order to prevent the entry of wind, etc.

original: gce rtsa rang gi sor gnyis kyis //
analyzed: gce rtsa rang gi sor gnyis kyis //
translated: The base is to be closed by two fingers

original: chod par 'gag pa gnyis pa bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chod par 'gag pa gnyis pa bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and a second knot is to be made.

analyzed: de bzhin du gce'u de'i rtsa ba'i phyogs su rang gi zhes pa nad pa bdag nyid kyi sor gnyis kyis chod par 'gag pa gnyis pa bya ste /
translated: Here, “the base” means the base of the tube. “The base is to be closed by two fingers” means that the tube is to be closed by two fingers of the patient himself.

analyzed: de la rkyal bu gdags shing bcing dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a bag is to be attached and tied to it.

original: der ni rkyal bu gdags bya ba //
analyzed: der ni rkyal bu gdags bya ba //

analyzed: ra lug ma he la sogs pa'i // lgang pa legs mnyes sra ba dang // dmar btsos bu ga thag thug med //

original: dri nga rtsa ris med srab par //
analyzed: dri nga rtsa ris med srab par //
translated: without bad smell, without veins, and thin.

original: sman ni legs par blugs byas la //
analyzed: sman ni legs par blugs byas la //
translated: The medicine is well-poured into it,

original: srad bus dam par bcing bar bya //
analyzed: srad bus dam par bcing bar bya //
translated: and it is tightly bound with string.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is meant.

analyzed: gag pa gnyis kyi bar du lug la sogs pa'i lgang ba'i rkyal bu legs par mnyes pa dang / de bzhin du sra ba ste ma gas pa dang dmar por btsos te tshon gzhan gyi kha dog med pa thag thug med cing mdud pa chags pa med cing rul ba la sogs pa'i dri nga ba med pa rtsa'i ri mo med pas srab ste mthug ba ma

original: yin pa / de lta bur sman bde bar blugs shing gzhag la /
analyzed: yin pa / de lta bur sman bde bar blugs shing gzhag la /

analyzed: srad bu sra bas legs par dam  du bcing bar bya'o // lgang med rkyal pa'i dpung pa'am //

original: byin pa'i lpags sam ras stug bzang //
analyzed: byin pa'i lpags sam ras stug bzang //
translated: or the skin of the thigh, or a good thick cloth,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽gong du smos pa lta bu'i lgang pa med na rkyal pa'i dpung pa bcad pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gong du smos pa lta bu'i lgang pa med na rkyal pa'i dpung pa bcad pa'am /

analyzed: chu thub ba las sman blugs pa'i snod bya'o //
translated: Or, a thick, good cloth without holes should be smeared with lac and so on, and a vessel for pouring medicine should be made that is waterproof.

original: ni ru ha tshad dang po ni //
analyzed: ni ru ha tshad dang po ni //
translated: The first measure of niruha is

original: lo gcig pa la srang gcig mchog / ji srid srang ni bcu gnyis bar //
analyzed: lo gcig pa la srang gcig mchog / ji srid srang ni bcu gnyis bar //
translated: one pala for a one year old, the best, up to twelve palas,

analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nyid yon tan shas che bar byed pa yin /
translated: Similarly, they act with a great deal of good qualities.

original: de bzhin du chung zhing dman par yang byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chung zhing dman par yang byed pa ste /
translated: Similarly, they act with a small amount and with inferior qualities.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan gyi khyad par yod pa la brten nas /🔽tshad chen por bshad pa gsum pa ni spang ba dang bcas shing gnod pa dang bcas su zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan gyi khyad par yod pa la brten nas / tshad chen por bshad pa gsum pa ni spang ba dang bcas shing gnod pa dang bcas su zin kyang /
translated: Because of the special qualities of such a person,🔽the third is explained as a great measure,🔽because it is taught that one should do only that which is a great measure,

original: tshad chen po dag bya ba kho na ston pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad chen po dag bya ba kho na ston pa yin te /
translated: even though it may be associated with something to be abandoned and something harmful.

original: de bzhin du skabs kyis gzhan dag kyang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs kyis gzhan dag kyang bshad pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, others are explained in this context.

original: snum dangs ma btung ba ni spang bar bya ba dang bcas shing /
analyzed: snum dangs ma btung ba ni spang bar bya ba dang bcas shing /
translated: Drinking oil is associated with something to be abandoned,

original: mi mthun pa'i skabs gnod pa'i skabs spang ba med pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i skabs gnod pa'i skabs spang ba med pa ma yin yang /
translated: and it is not that there is no occasion for harm or no occasion for abandoning it.

original: 'on kyang zhun mar la sogs pa'i snum dangs ma bsten par bshad pa ni myur du byed pa dang / yon tan che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhun mar la sogs pa'i snum dangs ma bsten par bshad pa ni myur du byed pa dang / yon tan che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is explained that one should rely on oil such as ghee because it is done quickly and it has great qualities.

original: de bzhin du spyil bur gnas nas bcud kyis len nye bar bsten pa dang / de bzhin du rlung dang / tshad par gnas nas rlung dang nyi tshan gyi cho gas bcud kyis len bsten par byed pa de gnyis la khyad par med par gyur na spyil bur gnas pa'i cho ga spang ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyil bur gnas nas bcud kyis len nye bar bsten pa dang / de bzhin du rlung dang / tshad par gnas nas rlung dang nyi tshan gyi cho gas bcud kyis len bsten par byed pa de gnyis la khyad par med par gyur na spyil bur gnas pa'i cho ga spang ba dang /
translated: Similarly, there is no difference between staying in a hut and relying on alchemical means and staying in a windy or hot place and relying on alchemical means through the rites of wind and sun.🔽

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa su zhig ston par byed na /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa su zhig ston par byed na /
translated: Similarly, if there is no difference between the two, one who abides in a hut and relies on a nutrient elixir and one who abides in wind and sun and relies on a nutrient elixir through the rite of wind and sun, then who would teach the rite of abiding in a hut?

original: gang gi phyir spyil bu la gnas pa ni myur bar byed pa dang / yon tan che ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyil bu la gnas pa ni myur bar byed pa dang / yon tan che ba yin la /
translated: Because abiding in a hut is swift and has great qualities.

original: rlung dang tshad par gnas pa ni ring zhig na byed pa dang / yon tan chung ba yin te /
analyzed: rlung dang tshad par gnas pa ni ring zhig na byed pa dang / yon tan chung ba yin te /
translated: Abiding in wind and sun is slow and has few qualities.

original: tshad 'di gnyis kyi khyad par yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshad 'di gnyis kyi khyad par yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The difference between these two measures is also like that.

original: de bzhin du 'jam rtse mas gtong ba'i tshad kyang de dang 'dra bar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jam rtse mas gtong ba'i tshad kyang de dang 'dra bar bshad pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the measure of applying ointment is explained to be like that.

original: des na 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba ni myur du byed pa dang / yon tan che ba yin la /
analyzed: des na 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba ni myur du byed pa dang / yon tan che ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, applying ointment is swift and has great qualities.

original: 'jam rtsi tshad shin tu chung ba'i mas gtong ba ni ring zhig na byed pa dang / yon tan chung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'jam rtsi tshad shin tu chung ba'i mas gtong ba ni ring zhig na byed pa dang / yon tan chung ba yin na /
translated: The one who gives a small amount of ointment does so after a long time, and his quality is small.

original: de bas na khyad par 'di gnyis la brten nas 'jam rtsi tshad dang ldan pa dag ni spang bar bya ba dang / gnod pa dang bcas su zin kyang bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par 'di gnyis la brten nas 'jam rtsi tshad dang ldan pa dag ni spang bar bya ba dang / gnod pa dang bcas su zin kyang bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the one who gives a proper amount of ointment is to be rejected on the basis of these two distinctions, even if he is a teacher who is of little benefit.

original: mas gtong ba chung ngu chung ngus byed pa gcig bum bshad de /
analyzed: mas gtong ba chung ngu chung ngus byed pa gcig bum bshad de /
translated: The one who gives a small amount of ointment does so after a long time, and his quality is small.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'bras bu khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'bras bu khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: These two have a different result.

original: dza la sgron shing rdzi ban ti //🔽@240a * // gla sgang shing tsha pu shel tsi //
analyzed: dza la sgron shing rdzi ban ti // @240a * // gla sgang shing tsha pu shel tsi //
translated: Jala, sron-shing, rdzi-ban-ti,🔽gla-gang, shing-tsha, pu-shil-tsi,

original: go bi tsandan skyer pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: go bi tsandan skyer pa'i rtsa //
translated: go-bi, tsanda-n, gyer-pa’i-rtsa,

original: shing mngar gla ba aa ka ru //
analyzed: shing mngar gla ba aa ka ru //
translated: shing-mngar, gla-ba, a-ka-ru,

original: nye'u shing bil ba punda r'i //
analyzed: nye'u shing bil ba punda r'i //
translated: nye’u-shing, bil-ba, pun-da-ri,

original: autpal mur parni gnyis //
analyzed: autpal mur parni gnyis //
translated: u-tpala, mur-par-ni-gnyis,🔽bri-ha-ti-gnyis, byi-dang-g, gandha-bha-dra, sug-smel,

original: bri ha ti gnyis byi dang ga / gandha bha dra sug smel dang // ha re nu ka padma yi //
analyzed: bri ha ti gnyis byi dang ga / gandha bha dra sug smel dang // ha re nu ka padma yi //
translated: ha-re-nu-ka, pad-ma-yi,

original: ge sar dang ni ba la ste //
analyzed: ge sar dang ni ba la ste //
translated: ge-sar, dang-ni, ba-la-ste,

original: sman ni 'di rnams cha snyoms la //
analyzed: sman ni 'di rnams cha snyoms la //
translated: These medicines are equal parts.

original: char pa'i chus ni bskol bar bya //
analyzed: char pa'i chus ni bskol bar bya //
translated: Cook with rainwater.

original: til mar las ni sman gyi khu //
analyzed: til mar las ni sman gyi khu //
translated: From the oil, make a decoction of medicine.

original: bcu 'gyur lhag byas de las ni //
analyzed: bcu 'gyur lhag byas de las ni //
translated: Ten times more, and from that

original: til mar chu dang bskol bya ba //🔽lan bcu nyid ni bskol nas ni //
analyzed: til mar chu dang bskol bya ba // lan bcu nyid ni bskol nas ni //
translated: Cook the oil with water.🔽Cook ten times itself.

original: tshos pa yi ni bcu cha la //
analyzed: tshos pa yi ni bcu cha la //
translated: Of the cooked, one-tenth part

original: de mnyam ra yi 'o ma blugs //
analyzed: de mnyam ra yi 'o ma blugs //
translated: Add an equal amount of goat's milk.

original: snar btang til mar yon tan che //
analyzed: snar btang til mar yon tan che //
translated: Use as nasal medication, this great oil

original: thigs phran zhes bya 'di bsten bya //
analyzed: thigs phran zhes bya 'di bsten bya //
translated: Called Drop by Drop should be relied upon.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dza la zhes bya ba ni rtsva sman ba la ka'o //
analyzed: dza la zhes bya ba ni rtsva sman ba la ka'o //
translated: Jala is the grass medicine Valaka.

original: dzi ban ti ni grags par zad do //🔽go bi ni shi ri ba'o //
analyzed: dzi ban ti ni grags par zad do // go bi ni shi ri ba'o //
translated: Jivanti is well-known.🔽Govaccha is Shirisha.

original: gla ba ni ba ri pe la'o //
analyzed: gla ba ni ba ri pe la'o //
translated: Gavaksha is Variegated.

original: nye'u shing ni sha ta pa ri'o //
analyzed: nye'u shing ni sha ta pa ri'o //
translated: Nemi is Shatapari.

original: punda r'i ni pra punda r'i ka'o //
analyzed: punda r'i ni pra punda r'i ka'o //
translated: Punarnavam is Prapunarnavaka.

original: autpa la ni autpa la sngon po'o //
analyzed: autpa la ni autpa la sngon po'o //
translated: Utpalam is blue lotus.

original: mu ra ni gan dmu ra'o //🔽parni gnyis ni sa la parni dang / krishna parni'o //
analyzed: mu ra ni gan dmu ra'o // parni gnyis ni sa la parni dang / krishna parni'o //
translated: Mura is Gandemura.🔽Parni is both Shaliparni and Krishnaparni.

original: bri ha ti gnyis ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri'o //
analyzed: bri ha ti gnyis ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri'o //
translated: Vrihati is both Vrihati and Kantakari.

original: ha re nu ka ni re nu ka'o //
analyzed: ha re nu ka ni re nu ka'o //
translated: Harenu is the same as renu.

original: padma'i ge sar ni padma'i snying po'i ge sar ro //
analyzed: padma'i ge sar ni padma'i snying po'i ge sar ro //
translated: The filaments of the lotus are the filaments of the lotus heart.

original: ba la ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: ba la ni grags par zad do //
translated: Bala is well known.

original: sman 'di rnams legs par cha snyoms la /
analyzed: sman 'di rnams legs par cha snyoms la /
translated: These herbs should be well mixed.

original: de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi char pa'i chu dang bskol ba ji srid til mar gyi bcu 'gyur lus par 'gyur gyi bar du bskol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi char pa'i chu dang bskol ba ji srid til mar gyi bcu 'gyur lus par 'gyur gyi bar du bskol bar bya'o //
translated: Eight times the amount of water should be boiled until only one-tenth the amount of oil remains.

original: de ltar sman gyi khu ba til mar gyi bcu 'gyur lus par byas la /🔽de'i 'og tu bskol ba'i chu til mar gyi bcu 'gyur yod pa la /
analyzed: de ltar sman gyi khu ba til mar gyi bcu 'gyur lus par byas la / de'i 'og tu bskol ba'i chu til mar gyi bcu 'gyur yod pa la /
translated: Thus, the herbal juice should be reduced to one-tenth the amount of oil.🔽Then, in the boiling water that is one-tenth the amount of oil,

original: de la til mar cha gcig dang / lan bcu'i bar du bskol bar bya'o /
analyzed: de la til mar cha gcig dang / lan bcu'i bar du bskol bar bya'o /
translated: one part of oil should be boiled up to ten times.

original: lhag pa 'am ma tshang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa 'am ma tshang ba ma yin no //
translated: There should be no excess or deficiency.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba smos pa yin no //
translated: This itself is stated as a specification.

original: de la til mar chos pa'i tshad ni ci nas sman bskol ba'i chu de bcu cha re re dang so sor bskol bas rdzogs kyi bar du bskol nas /
analyzed: de la til mar chos pa'i tshad ni ci nas sman bskol ba'i chu de bcu cha re re dang so sor bskol bas rdzogs kyi bar du bskol nas /
translated: The measure of the oil to be boiled is such that the water boiled with the herbs is boiled down to one-tenth the amount of each individual herb until it is complete.

original: til mar de tshos par gyur pa de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: til mar de tshos par gyur pa de ltar bya'o //
translated: The sesame oil should be cooked like that.

original: tshos pa bcu cha de dang mnyam pa'i ra'i 'o ma blugs par bya ste /
analyzed: tshos pa bcu cha de dang mnyam pa'i ra'i 'o ma blugs par bya ste /
translated: One-tenth of the cooked [oil] should be mixed with goat's milk.

original: gang dang mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang mnyam zhe na /
translated: With what is it equal?

original: til mar dang bskol ba'i chu dang mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: til mar dang bskol ba'i chu dang mnyam par bya'o //
translated: It should be equal to the water boiled with sesame oil.
